description: From Latin crepitare (“to creak, rattle, clatter, crackle”), frequentative of crepare (“to creak, rattle, etc., burst or break with a noise, crash”).

verbs.description: crepitate (third-person singular simple present crepitates, present participle crepitating, simple past and past participle crepitated)

definitionGroups.group: To crackle, to make a crackling sound.

entries.meaning: (medicine) to crackle, as crepitant lungs do, as some arthritic joints may do, or as some fractured bones may do.
